functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: In what year was each member of Blackpink born?
In what year was each member of Blackpink born?

<document>
<title>Jennie (singer)</title>
<fragment>

On June 1, 2016, Jennie was the first member to be revealed for YG Entertainment's newest girl group, its first in seven years since 2NE1.[32] On August 8, 2016, she debuted as a member of Blackpink, alongside Kim Jisoo, Roseanne Park and Lalisa Manobal, with the release of their single album *Square One* alongside double A-side singles "Boombayah" (붐바야) and "Whistle" (휘파람).[33] According to band-mate Jisoo, Jennie was responsible for the general duties and decision making of the group.[34][35] Jennie recounted her six-year experience as a trainee through V Live, stating each month a group, dance, and solo song were performed for the label's CEO, producers and artists to watch and evaluate the progress of their training. She also recalled memories preparing outfits and songs, making musical accompaniments, and practicing choreography.[36]



### 2018–present: Rising popularity, solo debut and acting debut[edit]

## Awards and nominations[edit]


See also: List of awards and nominations received by Blackpink




</fragment>
<fragment>
Her family supported her decision, and she moved back to South Korea in 2010, where she studied at Cheongdam Middle School.[13][12][14] Jennie auditioned for YG Entertainment that same year with Rihanna's "Take a Bow", succeeding in joining the label as a trainee.[15] Through *High Cut* Korea, she revealed because she was afraid of strangers and reluctant to take initiative, she could barely introduce herself during her audition.[16] Initially a vocalist, the company believed she should embrace the role of a rapper as most songs she covered included raps and she was the only trainee fluent in English at the time, along with her native Korean; she also knows basic Japanese and has learned French.[17][18][19]



## Career[edit]


### 2012–2017: Career beginnings and debut with Blackpink[edit]


Main article: Blackpink


</fragment>
</document>

msg.content:
<document>
<title>Jisoo</title>
<fragment>

1. **^** Herman, Tamar (October 22, 2018). "BLACKPINK Sign With Interscope Records & UMG in Global Partnership With YG Entertainment: Exclusive". *Billboard*. Archived from the original on October 23, 2018. Retrieved November 23, 2018.
2. ^ ***a*** ***b*** ***c*** ***d*** "Jisoo". *The Business of Fashion*. September 30, 2019. Archived from the original on February 3, 2020. Retrieved October 6, 2019.
3. **^** Daly, Rhian (January 4, 2019). "A beginner's guide to Blackpink, the all-singing, all-rapping, all-female K-pop band". *NME*. Archived from the original on October 3, 2020. Retrieved February 11, 2022.
4. **^** Son, Minji (June 23, 2017). "[아이돌 고향을 찾아서①] 우리 고향 아이돌 누가 있을까". *Sports Tendency (in Korean)*. Archived from the original on June 5, 2020. Retrieved April 20, 2019.
5. **^** Barredo, Charlie (May 3, 2020). "WILD ROMANCE! Blackpink and Lady Gaga are teaming up". *ABS-CBN*. Archived from the original on May 5, 2020. Retrieved February 11, 2022.

</fragment>
<fragment>

In 2011, Jisoo joined YG Entertainment as a trainee after passing its auditions.[11] In October 2014, she appeared in Epik High's music video for "Spoiler + Happen Ending" as a heartbroken girl.[12] The same year, she starred in Hi Suhyun's music video for "I'm Different"[13] as Bobby's girlfriend.[14] In 2015, Jisoo made a cameo appearance in the KBS2 drama *The Producers* with labelmates Sandara Park of 2NE1 and Kang Seung-yoon of Winner.[14]



### 2016–2022: Debut with Blackpink, solo endeavors and acting[edit]


Main article: Blackpink

![](image)Jisoo at the Korea Music Festival, performing As If It's Your Last on October, 2017.
Jisoo debuted as one of the four members of girl group Blackpink on August 8, 2016, alongside Jennie, Rosé and Lisa, with the release of their single album *Square One*.[10]


</fragment>
<fragment>

9. ^ ***a*** ***b*** ***c*** "BLACKPINK's Jennie, Rosé, Jisoo, and Lisa: What to Know". Marie Claire. October 14, 2020. Archived from the original on October 18, 2020. Retrieved March 13, 2021.
10. ^ ***a*** ***b*** Moon, Kat (April 3, 2019). "Everything to Know About K-Pop Group BLACKPINK". *Time*. Archived from the original on November 8, 2020. Retrieved February 11, 2022.

msg.name: search

msg.content:
<document>
<title>Lisa (rapper)</title>
<fragment>

In 2011, Lisa moved to South Korea to begin her formal training as a trainee. She officially joined the label as its first non-ethnically Korean trainee on April 11.[18] In November 2013, she appeared in the music video for labelmate Taeyang's single "Ringa Linga" as a background dancer alongside members of labelmates and boy bands iKon and Winner.[19] In March 2015, Lisa undertook her first modelling job for the streetwear brand Nona9on, followed by South Korean cosmetics brand Moonshot in 2016.[20]



### 2016–present: Debut with Blackpink and solo ventures[edit]


Main article: Blackpink

![](image)Lisa performing in May 2017
In August 2016, Lisa debuted as one of four members of South Korean girl group Blackpink, the first non-ethnically Korean artist under the label.[21][8] Blackpink's debut single album *Square One* featured lead singles "Whistle", which topped all South Korean charts upon debut, and "Boombayah".[22]


</fragment>
<fragment>
15. **^** Kim Yu-rim (April 17, 2020). "'블랙핑크' 리사 국적은 어디?" [What is Blackpink Lisa's Nationality?]. *MoneyS* (in Korean). Archived from the original on June 13, 2020. Retrieved April 29, 2021.
16. **^** Jason Pham (January 1, 2020). "Blackpink's 4 Members Were Discovered in Completely Different Ways". *Stylecaster*. Archived from the original on January 27, 2021. Retrieved January 30, 2021.
17. **^** "Danny Im (1TYM) - Ep. 39". *Fun With Dumb*. May 22, 2019. Archived from the original on February 7, 2021. Retrieved January 31, 2021.

msg.name: search

msg.content:
<document>
<title>Lisa (rapper)</title>
<fragment>

In 2011, Lisa moved to South Korea to begin her formal training as a trainee. She officially joined the label as its first non-ethnically Korean trainee on April 11.[18] In November 2013, she appeared in the music video for labelmate Taeyang's single "Ringa Linga" as a background dancer alongside members of labelmates and boy bands iKon and Winner.[19] In March 2015, Lisa undertook her first modelling job for the streetwear brand Nona9on, followed by South Korean cosmetics brand Moonshot in 2016.[20]



### 2016–present: Debut with Blackpink and solo ventures[edit]


Main article: Blackpink

![](image)Lisa performing in May 2017
In August 2016, Lisa debuted as one of four members of South Korean girl group Blackpink, the first non-ethnically Korean artist under the label.[21][8] Blackpink's debut single album *Square One* featured lead singles "Whistle", which topped all South Korean charts upon debut, and "Boombayah".[22]

msg.name: search

msg.content:
The birth years of each member of Blackpink are as follows:

1. **Jennie**: Born on January 16, 1996.
2. **Jisoo**: Born on January 3, 1995.
3. **Lisa**: Born on March 27, 1997.
4. **Rosé**: Born on February 11, 1997.

The birth years of each member of Blackpink are as follows:

1. **Jennie**: Born on January 16, 1996.
2. **Jisoo**: Born on January 3, 1995.
3. **Lisa**: Born on March 27, 1997.
4. **Rosé**: Born on February 11, 1997.
